description: Scheffler ties course record at France's Le Golf National to win gold for the United States
title: Scottie Scheffler wins Olympic gold after a comeback victory

description: Bobby Finke came to Paris the reigning Olympic champion in the 1,500 meter freestyle swim. He defended his title with a gold medal win and shattered the world record.
title: Olympic triumph: U.S. swimmer Bobby Finke wins gold, sets world record in 1,500 free

description: Djokovic is the all-time leader for most Grand Slam men's singles titles and one of only three men to hold all four Grand Slam championships simultaneously. But an Olympic gold had escaped him.
title: At 37 and already a tennis superstar, Novak Djokovic wins first Olympic gold medal

description: The storm is expected to reach hurricane-strength before it makes landfall in Florida on Monday. It could drop record-breaking rainfall amounts in parts of Georgia and South Carolina.
title: Florida prepares for the arrival of a strengthening Tropical Storm Debby

description: While athletes are focused on the sports, some fans at the Olympics are busy trading souvenir pins from different countries.
title: Fans at the Olympics are trading commemorative pins from different countries

description: At the Paris Summer Olympics, gymnasts Simone Biles and Stephen Nedoroscik were going for individual medals in the vault and pommel horse.
title: Women are leading the medal tally for Team USA at the Olympics

description: Venezuela's president, Nicolas Maduro, continues to insist he won last week's election, but proof is scarce. Meanwhile, Venezuelans continue to protest.
title: Protests over election results in Venezuela aren't losing steam

description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with Liz Landers, a national correspondent at Scripps News, about false information that has been appearing on social media to influence the 2024 election.
title: Social media is flooded with disinformation about the presidential candidates

description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump is trying to renegotiate the terms of a debate he had earlier agreed to. Also, Vice President Kamala Harris will announce her running mate imminently.
title: Politics chat: Trump and the presidential debate, Harris' running mate announcement

description: Paris displaced thousands of people living in encampments on the edge of Paris to make way for the games.
title: In Paris, the Olympics pushed out thousands living on the edge of the city

description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with Harvard economics professor Raj Chetty about new research showing increased economic mobility among Black adults who grew up poor.
title: The racial income gap has narrowed for Black Americans, new research shows

description: Is there anything to the social media craze for using magnesium supplements to help you get to sleep?
title: Magnesium is social media's new favorite magic aid for sleep. Here's what science says

description: After the Maui wildfires worsened a massive housing shortage on the island, many community members advocated for government officials to take action against short term vacation rentals. Now, they are.
title: A new bill could bring relief to those displaced after the wildfires in Maui

description: Some Olympic athletes prepared for Paris with a technique for acclimatizing to hot weather. Healthy people can take a cue from them, medical experts say, to build up tolerance for heat.
title: Heat training can help athletes -- and the rest of us -- adapt to hotter weather

description: Thailand has taken some steps toward democracy. But a flurry of court challenges has raised the specter of another crisis — with the lèse-majesté law on royal defamation front and center.
title: Thailand still grapples with a strict law against criticizing the monarchy

description: A young political dissident in Europe made his name in the news media as a defiant critic of the Chinese Communist Party. His former housemate and alleged victim says he's a grifter.
title: Is a high-profile critic of the Chinese Communist Party a con man?

description: In the moments before many Paris Olympic events get underway, someone comes out and taps a staff. The ritual, inspired by a French theatrical tradition, made its Olympics debut last week.
title: What’s that thumping sound in Paris? A dramatic new pre-game Olympics custom
